item.title: A characterization of graphs $G$ with $m_G(\lambda)= 2c(G) + q_s(G) - 1$
item.description: arXiv:2411.04770v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $G$ be a simple connected graph. If every pendant path in $G$ is at least $P_s$, we denote that $G\in \mathbb{G}_s$. For $G \in \mathbb{G}_s$, let $Q_s(G)$ be the set of vertices in $G$ that are distance $s$ from the pendant vertex, and let $|Q_s(G)| = q_s(G)$. For $G \in \mathbb{G}_s$, Li et al. (2024) proved that when $\lambda$ is not an eigenvalue of $P_s$ and $G$ is neither a cycle nor a starlike tree $T_k$, it holds that $m_G(\lambda) \leq 2c(G) + q_s(G) - 1$ and characterized the extremal graphs when $G$ is a tree. In this article, we characterize the extremal graphs for which $m_G(\lambda) = 2c(G) + q_s(G) - 1$ when $G \in \mathbb{G}_{s}$ and $\lambda\notin \sigma(P_s)$. Furthermore, we extend some of the results of Li et al. using star sets.
item.dc:creator: Songnian Xu, Wenhao Zhen, Dein Wong

item.title: From orbital magnetism to bulk-edge correspondence
item.description: arXiv:2107.13456v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: By extending the gauge covariant magnetic perturbation theory to operators defined on half-planes, we prove that for $2d$ random ergodic magnetic Schr\"odinger operators, the zero-temperature bulk-edge correspondence can be obtained from a general bulk-edge duality at positive temperature involving the bulk magnetization and the total edge current. Our main result is encapsulated in a formula, which states that the derivative of a large class of bulk partition functions with respect to the external constant magnetic field, equals the expectation of a corresponding edge distribution function of the velocity component which is parallel to the edge. Neither spectral gaps, nor mobility gaps, nor topological arguments are required. The equality between the bulk and edge indices, as stated by the conventional bulk-edge correspondence, is obtained as a corollary of our purely analytical arguments by imposing a gap condition and by taking a ``zero-temperature" limit.
item.dc:creator: Horia D. Cornean, Massimo Moscolari, Stefan Teufel

item.title: On spectral representation and sampling for unbounded continuous time signals
item.description: arXiv:2410.03667v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The paper establishes an analog Whittaker-Shannon-Kotelnikov sampling theorem with with fast decreasing coefficient, as well as a new modification of the corresponding interpolation formula applicable for general type non-vanishing unbounded continuous time signals with sublinear growth.
item.dc:creator: Nikolai Dokuchaev
